Bengaluru News
Heavy Rain Alert in Bengaluru Today As Southern Karnataka Drenches In Torrential Showers
Bengaluru is set to receive heavy rainfall on 17 July, with the IMD issuing a yellow alert for the city and surrounding districts. Rain is expected to continue throughout the week, with orange alerts for coastal regions and warnings of possible landslides in hilly areas.
Bengaluru Weather Alert: Heavy Rain Likely, IMD Issues Yellow Warning for City and Surrounding Districts
Bengaluru: After a relatively patchy start to the monsoon, Bengaluru is now bracing for heavy showers, as the Indian Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued a yellow alert for the city. According to the 7-day forecast, heavy rainfall is expected on 17 July, followed by consistent light to moderate showers until 22 July.
With many parts of Karnataka still struggling with deficient rain and parched fields, this shift comes as a double-edged sword — offering relief for some and potential disruption for others.
Heavy Rainfall Forecast Today, Warnings Issued Across Karnataka
The IMD has predicted a generally cloudy sky with heavy rainfall on Wednesday (17 July), followed by light rain in the subsequent days. The maximum and minimum temperatures are expected to hover around 30°C and 20°C respectively throughout the week.In addition to Bengaluru, several other districts have also been issued yellow alerts. These include Kodagu, Mysuru, Shivamogga, Chikkamagaluru, Chitradurga, Dharwad, Gadag, Koppal, Belagavi, Vijayapura, Kolar and Chikkaballapur. Residents in these areas have been advised to stay vigilant for sudden downpours and potential localised flooding.
Orange Alert for Coastal Karnataka, Schools Shut in Some Taluks
While most of southern Karnataka will see moderate rain, Udupi and Dakshina Kannada districts have been issued an orange alert for 16 July due to the likelihood of very heavy rainfall. Authorities have declared a holiday for schools and anganwadis in Ullal and Bantwal taluks as a precautionary measure."With the volume of rainfall expected in the next few days, we are taking preventive steps to avoid any safety hazards, especially for children and commuters," local officials said.
Watch Out for Landslides, Avoid Unnecessary Travel: IMD Warns
The IMD has also flagged risks of landslides in the hilly regions of Kodagu and Chikkamagaluru due to persistent rain. Travellers heading to these districts have been advised to avoid long journeys and exercise caution. "Stay indoors unless absolutely necessary. Travel in these areas should be postponed until conditions improve," the weather office advised.What to Expect in Bengaluru This Week
Here's a quick look at the IMD's forecast for Bengaluru:- 17 July: Heavy rain; yellow warning in place
Despite the absence of warnings after 17 July, light showers will persist, potentially affecting daily commuters, especially during peak hours. Authorities have already issued traffic advisories in several parts of the city due to ongoing waterlogging issues.
